item.title: Help with my first SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @Fink Fink
item.description:
@Fink wrote:

Thank you for the headsup about â€˜falseâ€™ Doomsday.

You are correct I donâ€™t know much, as I said at the start of my post.
I did get the loop part tho and I was on the right lines for the â€œaccess violation" â€¦. 1.5 out of 3 isnâ€™t sooo bad for a beginner.

And Re: â€œyou really need to learn scar before you try to help peopleâ€

  1. As the board has been quite quiet this week I thought something would be better than nothing…
    I would welcome comments to my posts even if they were from another n00b like me.

  2. I find that Teaching aids learning and look â€¦ now I know more about â€˜falseâ€™ too

  3. We will be fine so long as old hands like you are there to correct me/us

so Iâ€™m not gonna STFU just yet

Fink

oh and â€¦

I DO like the USA â€¦…
I donâ€™t know what that means â€¦…
And I feel duly PWND â€¦ :o

item.source: Help with my first SCAR script

item.title: Help with my first SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @doomsday doomsday
item.description:
@doomsday wrote:

okay here is the real help(i dont think he knows much)

program AlKharidWarriorOwner;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/Skill/Fighting.scar}
var
warriorColor1,warriorColor2,warriorColor3:integer;

procedure setup;
begin
warriorColor1:=0;
warriorColor2:=0;
warriorColor3:=0;
end;

procedure FindRandoms;
begin
  Writeln('Looking for randoms')
      SetRun(True)
  FindNormalRandoms;
  ClickToContinue;
  CloseWindow;
  FindLamp('hitpoints');
  FindDead;
  FindMod;
  FindMime;
  FindMaze;
  FindQuiz;
  FindFrog;
  FindDemon;
end;

procedure loginIfneeded;
begin
if LoggedIn=false then LoginPlayer;
end;
procedure ownGuards;
begin
AttackMonster(warriorColor1,warriorColor2,warriorColor3,'Al-Kharid Warrior',2);
end;

begin
//main line
repeat
setupsrl;
setup;
FindRandoms;
LoginIfNeeded;
ownGuards;
until(false);
end.

okay here is what i did, put a space between all of your procedures(makes it neater :D)

removed

var eats;// havnt add the eats procedure yet

when ever you add it back in, you need to put it on the same line, the second decleration of varibles was what was giving you there error

then the last this i did was add

repeat

to your script right after your main begin(for your main line) that fixes your need to remove the until(false) becasue before it had no idea what until(false) was for…

hope this help you with your scripting, if you need any help you can rely on me

and to fink

until(false) is a thing dude, you dont have to tell it shit!!! its already telling it do this forever(the reason its a false) now you could do this

[code]
c:=c+1
until(c=100)

put that in your script to replace your until(false) what this does is it adds 1 to c everytime it does the script then ends when c = 100

you really need to learn scar before you try to help people[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Help with my first SCAR script

item.title: Help with my first SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @Fink Fink
item.description:
@Fink wrote:

Ok, ill start by saying that Iâ€™m new to this too â€¦.

I canâ€™t set this up to test it on RS

I have no idea what the â€œAccess violationâ€ is all about. My guess would be that you need to check that the information you are sending the include is correct.

The

until(false);

statement has nothing to work on. You need to tell SCAR what false is and what you want it to mean.

The â€œIdentifier expected in scriptâ€ message generally means you need to add something to the var list. Thatâ€™s how you tell SCAR what the thing is.

The until command is generally the end of a loop. That would look something like

Repeat
Someprocedure;
Until (the thing you want happens

I will not be able to explain things any better than the excellent tutorial found in the sticky post here

http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=3700.0

I found, and still find, it VERY useful

HUGE thanks to driger1592 (liger?) for producing that ;D

Good luck with the scripting

Fink

Read full topic
item.source: Help with my first SCAR script

item.title: Help with my first SCAR script
item.dc:creator: @rabcarl rabcarl
item.description:
@rabcarl wrote:

Well, I am writing my first script (an al-kharid warrior killer) and I have a few questions. Does anyone know why it doesn’t compile unless i take out “until(false)” at the end? also after it compiles it says:

[Runtime Error] : Exception: Access violation at address 006549BC in module ‘scar.exe’. Read of address 00000000 in line 57 in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl\srl\core\GameTab.scar

anyways here’s the script:

program AlKharidWarriorOwner;
{.include SRL/SRL.scar}
{.include SRL/SRL/Skill/Fighting.scar}
var warriorColor1,warriorColor2,warriorColor3:integer;
var eats:boolean;//I haven’t gotten around to adding the eat procedure yet
procedure setup;
begin
warriorColor1:=0;
warriorColor2:=0;
warriorColor3:=0;
end;
procedure FindRandoms;
begin
Writeln(‘Looking for randoms’)
SetRun(True)
FindNormalRandoms;
ClickToContinue;
CloseWindow;
FindLamp(‘hitpoints’);
FindDead;
FindMod;
FindMime;
FindMaze;
FindQuiz;
FindFrog;
FindDemon;
end;
procedure loginIfneeded;
begin
if LoggedIn=false then LoginPlayer;
end;
procedure ownGuards;
begin
AttackMonster(warriorColor1,warriorColor2,warriorColor3,‘Al-Kharid Warrior’,2);
end;
begin
//main line
setup;
FindRandoms;
LoginIfNeeded;
ownGuards;
until(false);
end.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with my first SCAR script
